item.title: Raspberry Pi: Backup and NAS
item.description: As part of an effort to take back some amount of control of my own data from the cloud giants (unfortunately I’m talking more about the Googles of the world and less about the gigantic humanoids situated near the top of the Ordning), one of the first tasks I wanted to tackle was just a simple, redundant storage solution for my data.

item.title: spring cleaning my digital identity
item.description: I’d been reading up about git-secret and realized that I didn’t really grasp what a PGP key is or how to use one (or more). I’ve had a Keybase account since 2011, and it’s become a bit of a disjointed mess.

item.title: the dns and deployment of tlake.io
item.description: Porkbun is my new favorite domain registrar and had the best deals on .io domains that I could find, but I wanted to use DNSimple to manage my DNS settings. DNSimple offers a robust API and a Terraform provider, which is very appealing to my infrastructure-as-code aspirations.
